name: Tivian Access MVP (Minimum Viable Product)
title: Tivian Access MVP (Minimum Viable Product)
body:
Table of Contents

  • Preconditions
  • Changes
    • System configuration
    • EFS, People, Portal CMS, Webservices
    • Portals
  • Login / Logout workflow
    • EFS Admin user - customer without own IdP
    • Portal user - customer without own IdP
    • EFS Admin & Portal user - customer with own IdP
  • Multifactor Authentication
  • Forgot password workflow
  • IdP activation mail
  • Ideation workflow: inviting new contacts
  • Exception pages
  • Background
    • User data synchronization between EFS and Okta
    • IdP session
    • Others
  • Possible Flows

Preconditions

  • In order to ensure that users can login with SSO they need to be synced from EFS to Okta (third party Identity Provider), ie users need to be created in Okta as well

  • In case customer doesn’t have an own Identity Provider (IdP), he will use Tivians' IdP (Okta)

 

Changes

System configuration

  • New Tivian Access module to activate SSO with two configuration options for existing users:

    • Panelist migration to IdP , ie syncing first, last name and e-mail to Okta IdP

    • Panelist migration and Panelist activation (user gets an Okta activation mail to use new login)

  • New config flag to define which users should login with SSO:

    • EFS Admin users

    • Panelists

    • Admin users and Panelists

  • Further config parameter: Module "IdentityAccessManager"

 

EFS, People, Portal CMS, Webservices

  • EFS Admin users:

    • E-mail cannot be changed anymore, read-only

    • add / edit password option removed

    • first and last name mandatory

  • EFS Panelist

    • E-mail cannot be changed anymore, read-only

    • add / edit password still possible, but has only impact on panelists using Panel website

  • Portal CMS:

    • Login / Registration module: Sign in button instead of login mask

    • Settings > Access permissions > Login mask configuration disabled

  • Master Data survey > Master data allocation: survey variables cannot be allocated to Panelist E-mail anymore, ie panelist E-mail cannot be changed via allocation anymore

  • Webservices adaptation

 

Portals

  • Login mask replaced by sign in button with redirect to IdP

  • Portal user > Profile settings:

    • e-mail cannot be changed anymore, read-only

    • edit password option removed

Login / Logout workflow

EFS Admin user - customer without own IdP

  • User starts EFS app to access EFS admin area

  • He is redirected to Okta discovery page, where he enters his e-mail address, instead of getting redirected to the EFS Admin login page

  • Is user already existing in Okta, he will be forwarded to new login page (Okta), where he enters his IdP password

  • When signing in, he is redirected from login page into EFS landing page

  • When user logs out, he is redirected to a new logout page with a back to login link, which redirects him to Okta discovery page

 

Portal user - customer without own IdP

  • User starts Portals app

  • He sees a public page with a sign in button instead of Login mask

  • When clicking on call to action button, he is redirected to IdP discovery page (Okta)

  • User adds e-mail address

  • If E-mail exists in Okta, on the next page he adds his IdP password

  • When signing in, he is redirected from login page into Portal landing page

  • When user logs out, he is redirected to public page with sign in button

 

EFS Admin & Portal user - customer with own IdP

  • User starts an app

  • If user local session (Active Directory) is valid, user access the app directly

  • If user local session is expired, user will be redirected to Customer IdP login page, eg Conti login page instead of Okta login page, to enter e-mail and password

  • User accesses the app

  • User will be logged in EFS / Portals as long as he is logged into his AD

  • If user logs out from EFS / Portals he is forwarded to a logout page

  • In order to sign into the app again he just needs to enter his E-mail address and click on Next and he will be directly logged into the QB app

 

Multifactor Authentication

  • When MFA is activated, user will add his e-mail address on IdP discovery page

  • On the next page he will select for once an authentication type (sms, app, etc.) and configure it, in case several authentication types are set

  • User will be forwarded to the next page where he will see his encrypted mobile number or app authenticator and click on Send code

  • User will get a sms or an app notification with a code to enter on the IdP login page

  • User will finally accesses app after successfull login

 

Forgot password workflow

  • User clicks on IdP login page on Forgot password

  • He is forwarded to a new page where to enter his e-mail address

  • He will see a confirmation page and get a mail with a link to set a new password

  • Does the user add a new password successfully, he lands to a generic landing page “Thank you for using Tivian Access”

 

IdP activation mail

Case: An existing user without a customer (external) IdP wants to login into EFS / Portals with Tivian access for the first time

  • When QA module is activated and existing users are synced to Okta each user will be added to the IdP database and get an activation mail generated by Okta

  • User clicks on activation link and lands on a page where he can set a new password

  • Once the new password is set, the user is forwarded to a generic destination page “Welcome to Tivian Access”

  • If user starts his app he lands on (Okta) login page where he enters his e-mail address and his defined password and gets redirected to EFS / Portals

 

Case: An existing user with a customer (external) IdP wants to login into EFS / Portals with Tivian access for the first time

  • When customer IdP is connected to Okta IdP users will be synced to Okta and thus added to the IdP database automatically

  • Since user are logged in their own Active directory where passwords are also managed they don’t need a password from Okta and thus they don’t get an activation mail

  • Such users start a Tivian app and land on Discovery page where to enter their e-mail address in order to be logged into the app directly without adding their password

 

Ideation workflow: inviting new contacts

  • When a new, external contact is invited to access Portal, he will be created in EFS with e-mail verification status = „not verified“ (standard behaviour)

  • He will get an invitation mail to access portal

    • Placeholder from mail template will be replaced by a URL which won’t contain a lc code but an email address instead

    • Example: invitation to vote suggestions (voting page): http://iam-demo.qb-feedback.com/portal/review-guide?lc=a9e2092aa6d474e10685ce68624564412af8f6b17a556f90ae094e43b0ae7d66&route=cGFnZVNsdWc9cGFnZS0xMTE=

  • In case Panelist activated his account for the IdP (Okta) and IdP session is still valid and he clicks on the link:

    • in EFS panelist gets e-mail verification status = „verified“

    • in Portals he skips the mini registration page

    • he will be redirected directly to the destination page on Portals (Deeplink)

  • If the IdP session is expired, Panelist will be redirected to IdP login page to enter his e-mail address and password before accessing Portals

New panelist with landing page (Deeplinking) private page

Ideation workflow:

  • Starting the guide and inviting external contact

    • This contact will be added to EFS and Okta

  • Voting phase:

    • Panelist gets a mail with link to voting page

    • Panelist clicks on the link and

      • is redirected to Okta login page, in case Okta session is expired and needs to login again in order to get to the voting page

      • lands directly on the voting page, in case Okta session is still valid

  • action phase

    • Panelist gets a mail with link to action board to view results

    • Panelist clicks on the link and

      • is redirected to Okta login page, in case Okta session is expired, and needs to login again in order to get to the action board

      • lands directly on the voting page, in case Okta session is still valid

Exception pages

  • No permission page: in case a user doesn’t have permissions to access apps ( EFS / Portals ), but is existing in Okta, he will be forwarded to a page, where he will be informed, that he is not authorized to access the app and to contact admin to get support

  • Technical error page: in case communication between EFS and Okta breaks, user that tries to access app will be redirected to a page, where he will be informed, that a technical error occurred and he needs to contact admin to get support

 

Background

User data synchronization between EFS and Okta

  • Users are synced from EFS to Okta database when:

    • creating, importing and updating users (webservices included)

    • inviting panelists to a guide

  • Transferred data: first name, last name, E-mail

 

IdP session

  • Master session (Okta): per default 2h

  • Master session dominates local session (EFS)

  • When Okta session is killed, due to logout from EFS, user is logged out from Okta, but is still logged in EFS until EFS session expires

  • Exception: When user logs out from Portals, both Okta and Portals session are killed immediately and user is logged out from both - to be changed in the next version to be more consistent

 

Others

  • Root user (Super Admin) has own (Bypass) route to get access in EFS

  • When Portal user is landing on a public page he won‘t be redirected automatically to Okta login page, in contrast to a private page

  • When deleting Panelist in EFS, he won‘t be deleted automatically in Okta

  • When users access the same installation under different URLs, when redirected to Okta discovery page, they will all be redirected to a general URL after (eg.  http://iam-demo.qb-feedback.com)

 

Possible Flows

The cases below contain every useful/possible combination apart of every combination regarding sessions.

Flow name

ext. IdP

(is there an external Identity Provider)

IdP ID

(is the external IdP ID configured)

email

(is an email sent with the request)

session EFS

(is an EFS session present)

session Okta

(is an Okta session present)

session ext. IdP

(is a session at the external Identity Provider present)

email domain routed to IdP

(is the email domain part of the routing rule to the external IdP)

Steps

(what the user sees)

 

EFS


 

 

 

 

 

 

-

 

 

 

 

  1. Navigate to EFS

  2. Get redirected to external IdP

  3. provide email and password

  4. get logged in at EFS

 

 

 

-

 

 

 

 

  1. Navigate to EFS

  2. Get redirect to Okta discovery page

  3. Provide email

  4. Get redirected to external IdP

  5. Provide password (in case of SAML email again)

  6. Get logged in at EFS

 

 

 

-

 

 

 

 

  1. Navigate to EFS

  2. Get redirected to Okta discovery page

  3. Provide email

  4. Provide password

  5. Get logged in at EFS

 

 

-

 

-

 

 

 

 

-

  1. Navigate to EFS

  2. Get redirected to Okta discovery Page

  3. Provide email

  4. Provide password

  5. Get logged in at EFS

 

Email


 

 

 

 

-

 

 

 

 

 

  1. Click email link

  2. Get redirected to external IdP

  3. Provide password (in case of SAML also email)

  4. Get logged in at EFS

 

 

-

 

 

 

 

 

  1. Click email link

  2. Get redirected to Okta

  3. Provide password

  4. Get logged in at EFS

 

 

-

 

 

 

 

 

-

  1. Click email link

  2. Get redirected to Okta

  3. Provide password

  4. Get logged in at EFS
